meanings.definition: To give birth to a lamb.
meanings.sent1: The sheep lambed in the barn last night.
meanings.sent2: The ewe lambed twins this spring.
meanings.sent3: The farmer chuckled as the sheep lambed right before his eyes.
meanings.sent4: The field was lambed with new life as the lambs frolicked around.
meanings.sent5: The sound of lambed echoed through the quiet countryside.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, the ewe lambed in the pasture.
meanings.sent2: The sheep lambed early this morning.
meanings.sent3: The farmer was surprised when the sheep lambed so quickly.
meanings.sent4: The field was lambed with new arrivals as the lambs played together.
meanings.sent5: The lambed sheep rested peacefully in the shade.
